note: Minted object mapping option for <mods:titleInfo>. Use to relate the object being described to its minted title.

Minted object mapping option for <mods:name>. The mapping allows for the use of any term from the MARC Code List for Relators. For example, Author. Value is either text or IRI from a controlled vocabulary (like Library of Congress Name Authority File).
Minted object mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to relate the object being described to a minted origination information object.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:targetAudience>. Use to relate the object being described to its minted target audience.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:note>. Use to relate the object being described to its minted note value.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for topic and name subjects.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for geographic subjects.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for text-based temporal subjects that cannot be represented by an ​EDTF​ timespan (e.g. "French Revolution").
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to relate a commercial or bibliographic series object to the item being described.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to relate an archival series object to its parent collection.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the IRI for the event the item was produced as part of.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the IRI for the physical/source collection the item belongs to.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to link to an alternate version of the item.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to link to the administrative or primary digital collection the item belongs to.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to relate an archival series object to the item being described. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to link to the digital collection the item belongs to.
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the IRI for a parent item that the item being described belongs to. (Lexical alias: rdau:containedIn.en)
Minted object mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the IRI of a constituent item. (Lexical alias: rdau:containerOf.en)

Minted object mapping option for <mods:location>. Use for <mods:physicalLocation> values, preferably using an IRI for the organization from a controlled vocabulary such as VIAF of Library of Congress Real World Objects.

Minted object mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. Use to relate the object being described to an object representing the information about the metadata, such as provenance and description standards.
The class for minted title objects.
Use to indicate the type of a non-primary title (alternative, translated, etc.)
Use for the main title value, including leading articles and subtitles. (Non-sort articles should be handled via the application indexing logic.)
Use to indicate that the title has been supplied by cataloger.
Use to relate a minted title to a title with an existing IRI authority (e.g. uniform title).
Use to indicate a preferred title by indicating the IRI of the preferred title as the object.

Use this to list multiple names in a specific order associated with the object being described. Use semicolon as delimiter. The delimited list can include IRI values (as literals) or text values. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
A class for minted name objects.
A class for minted name objects.
A class for minted name objects.
Use this for the full name value as text.
Use to identify an exact match between a minted name and a name with an existing IRI authority (e.g. id.loc.gov).
Use for birth date in ISO 8601 date format.
Use for death date in ISO 8601 date format.

Used to connect this local minted object to an institution, organization, etc with which the entity recorded was associated at the time the resource was created. Value is from a controlled vocabulary (like Library of Congress Name Authority File) or another locally minted object.
The class for minted origination objects.
Subclass of bf:ProvisionActivity, use for minted origination events relating to item manufacture.
Subclass of bf:ProvisionActivity, use for minted origination events relating to item publication.
Use for edition statements typically found in <mods:edition>.
Use to represent the date of creation (<mods:dateCreated>) for the object, formatted as an EDTF​ string.
Use to represent the date of issuance (<mods:dateIssued>) for the object, formatted as an EDTF​ string.
Use to represent the place of distribution, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to represent the place of distribution, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Use to represent the place of manufacture, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to represent the place of manufacture, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the publication or any other general origination event.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the publication or any other general origination event.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the production of the item.
Use to represent the agent responsible for the production of the item.
Use to represent the place of production, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to represent the place of production, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to represent the place of publication, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to represent the place of publication, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Use to indicate an inferred date.
The class for minted target audience objects.
Use for the custom target audience value.
The class for minted note objects.
Use for the note type value.
Use for the note value.
The class for minted topical subjects.
The class for minted geographic subjects.
The class for minted personal name subjects.
The class for minted corporate name subjects.
The class for minted temporal subjects.
The class for minted uniform title subjects.
Use for bounding box coordinates.
Use for cartographic coordinates.
Use to identify an exact match between a minted non-topical subject (name, geographic, etc.) and a real-world object (place, person, etc.) with an existing IRI authority (e.g. id.loc.gov).
Use for the label of a minted subject.
Use for date-based temporal subjects, formatted as an EDTF​ timespan.
Use to link two concepts that are sufficiently similar that they can be used interchangeably in some information retrieval applications.
Use to identify an exact match between a minted subject and a subject with an existing IRI authority (e.g. id.loc.gov).
Use for birth date in ISO 8601 date format, in minted name subjects.
Use for death date in ISO 8601 date format, in minted name subjects.
Use to indicate a preferred title when several labels are provided for a minted subject.

Use to indicate the cartographic projection (<mods:cartographics><mods:projection>): "the method of representing the surface of a sphere or other shape on a plane." (Lexical alias: rdau:​projectionOfCartographicContent.en)
Use to indicate the cartographic scale (<mods:cartographics><mods:scale>). (Lexical alias: rdau:scale.en)
Use to link two closely related subjects of any type.
The class for minted physical or archival collection objects.
The class for minted conference name objects.
The class for minted archival series objects. (This class has been proposed, but not implemented.)
The class for minted bibliographic series objects. (This class has been proposed, but not implemented.)
The class for minted digital collection objects.
The class for minted related work objects.
Use for the edition number of the related item.
Use for the issue number of the related item.
Use for the volume number of the related item.
Use for the creator name of the related item.
Use for the publisher name of the related item.
Use for the date of publication for the related item.
Use for the name of a related conference.
Use for an identifier corresponding to a parent item that the item being described belongs to. Any identifier from the Library of Congress ​Standard Identifier Schemes​ may be used. For example, DOI.
Use for the title of the related item.
Use for ending page number.
Use for starting page number.
The class for minted organization objects.
Use for <mods:subLocation> values.
Use for <mods:shelfLocator> values. Append values from <mods:enumerationAndChronology> to the end of the literal.
Use for the title of the minted organization object.
Use to link the minted organization object to an existing IRI from another dataset (rdfs:seeAlso could also potentially be used here).
The class for minted metadata objects.
The most recent change date of the metadata record.
The date of creation for the original metadata record (may be different than the date of item creation in the repository).
The descriptions standard used for cataloging, preferably from a controlled vocabulary such as LoC ​Description Conventions​.
The language of cataloging, preferably from a controlled vocabulary, such as ​ISO 639-2​.
The organization responsible for creating the metadata record. Only used where this value may need to be differentiated from the institution managing the repository.
The organization responsible for creating the metadata record. Only used where this value may need to be differentiated from the institution managing the repository.
The organization responsible for making the metadata record and/or digital object available.
The organization responsible for making the metadata record and/or digital object available.
Information about the origin or provenance of the metadata record.
The class for minted institution or corporate name objects.
Use for the title of the minted organization object.
Use to link a minted institution object to a closely related existing authority or URI.
Direct mapping option for <mods:typeOfResource>. Use with a type from a controlled vocabulary (such as the LoC ​Resource Types Scheme​ or ​DCMI Type Vocabulary​).
Direct mapping option for <mods:genre>. Use with a genre term from a controlled vocabulary, or a local term.
Direct mapping option for <mods:genre>. Use with a genre term from a controlled vocabulary, or a local term.
Direct mapping option for <mods:language>. The language of the resource. Preference is to use a value from a controlled vocabulary, such as ​ISO 639-2​.
Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent MIME data typically found in <mods:internetMediaType>.

Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the physical form or medium of material for a resource (<mods:form>), preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as the Library of Congress TGMII or LCGFT.

Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the physical form or medium of material for a resource (<mods:form>), preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as the Library of Congress TGMII or LCGFT.
Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the method by which the resource became digital form (<mods:digitalOrigin>).
Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the extent of a resource (<mods:extent>). (Lexical alias: rdau:extent.en.)

Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent notes about a a resource (<mods:note>). @type attribute values for should be precede the element value with a semicolon+space separator. (See Example 2 below.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:abstract>. Use to represent an abstract (<mods:abstract>) for the object.
Direct mapping option for <mods:tableOfContents>. Use to represent table of contents information (<mods:tableOfContents>).
Direct mapping option for <mods:tableOfContents>. Use to represent table of contents information (<mods:tableOfContents>).
Direct mapping option for <mods:classification>. Use for values from Dewey Decimal Classification.
Direct mapping option for <mods:classification>. Use for values from Library of Congress Classification.

Direct mapping option for <mods:classification>. The mapping allows for the use of any designator/code from the Library of Congress ​Classification Schemes. For example, Universal decimal classification.
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. For primary system identifier (ARK, PID, Handle, UUID, etc.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. For primary system identifier (ARK, PID, Handle, UUID, etc.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for any IRI identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​Library of Congress Control Numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Book Numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Serial Numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Digital Object Identifier (DOIs)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Digital Object Identifier (DOIs)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for local identifiers.
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for local identifiers including local call numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Music Number identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Handle system identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Handle system identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Recording Code identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for accession numbers. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for legacy accession numbers. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for local barcodes. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. For local, free-text rights statements.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to designate the copyright owner for the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to designate the copyright owner for the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to describe any restrictions on access.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to describe any restrictions on access.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. This would be for IRIs such as those from rightsstatement.org
